text: Chuck Schumer recently threatened two justices on our Supreme Court. It’s clear that national Democrats will go to drastic lengths to gain power, including threatening our independent judiciary.  We cannot let Chuck Schumer become Senate Majority Leader.

Senator Dan Sullivan recently sat down with KTUU's Rebecca Palsha to discuss a number of important issues, including preparedness in response to the spread of COVID-19: "In the Congress we're focused right now on spending legislation – really surge legislation – that will be in the billions [to respond]. We're working with Democrats, Republicans, the Trump administration ... to make sure there is preparedness at the state and local level on this important issue... the CDC just announced recently we are one of the test sites for coronavirus – our state, labs for testing in Fairbanks and in Anchorage that are up and running as of yesterday. This is important because it will enable us to have diagnostics – if and when this hits Alaska – very quickly."

For 100 years, the Disabled American Veterans (DAV), a million-member veterans service organization, has been a strong advocate for generations of America's veterans and their families. Dan Sullivan and his team have worked hard for America's veterans, which is why he was named DAV’s 2020 Outstanding Legislator of the Year.

Democracy in action this past weekend at so many #AKGOP district conventions across the state. Great turnout and great grassroots engagement! 75-years-ago – when six U.S. Marines raised the American flag atop Mt. Suribachi – an unwavering symbol of freedom, hope, and sacrifice was displayed to the world. As a Colonel in the U.S. Marine Corps Reserve, I was especially proud to join The Story with Martha MacCallum to honor the remarkable sacrifices and heroism of the United States Marine Corps and Navy during the Battle of Iwo Jima.

Eight million tons. That's how much plastic waste enters our oceans every year. This waste threatens the health of our oceans in Alaska and across the globe. Cleaning up our oceans is not a partisan issue, it's an issue that should unite us all. That's why I've worked across the aisle on 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙝𝙚𝙣𝙨𝙞𝙫𝙚 𝙢𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙚 𝙙𝙚𝙗𝙧𝙞𝙨 𝙡𝙚𝙜𝙞𝙨𝙡𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙥𝙖𝙨𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙎𝙚𝙣𝙖𝙩𝙚.
75-years-ago, U.S. Marines raised the American flag over Iwo Jima. We honor the life, legacy, and sacrifice of all who fought that day. Semper Fi.

National Democrats continue to wage war on Alaska and the future of our economy. Look no further than the radical views of Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren and their allies: “I think we should stop all new drilling and mining on public lands and all offshore drilling.” — Elizabeth Warren 2/19/20
To all of our great presidents, we honor you. Happy Presidents Day!

Happy Valentine’s Day to the love of my life, Julie. We recently celebrated 25 years of marriage with a visit back to  St. Matthew's Church in Fairbanks. Thank you, Julie, for being the best wife, mother, and partner I could ask for.

The federal government just awarded a much needed $20 million grant to the Port of Alaska for infrastructure development. Not only is this port a critical hub for our state – ensuring we have the groceries, fuel, and goods we need – it’s also vital to our national security.
We had a great gathering of Alaskans over the weekend. Many familiar faces, and many new ones!

This afternoon, I voted to acquit President Trump of the charges brought against him. It’s time to close this divisive chapter in our country’s history and get back to the work that Alaskans want us to focus on. I’m as motivated as ever to work with my colleagues in the Senate to deliver even more wins to the people of Alaska and the entire country.

Partisan impeachments every few years are not what the Founding Fathers intended, and would harm our country for generations. A vote by the Senate to pursue additional evidence that the House consciously chose not to obtain would incentivize less thorough, and more frequent, partisan impeachments in the future—a danger that should concern all Alaskans, regardless of political party.

I posed this question during the impeachment proceedings in the Senate: Given that the Senate is now considering the very evidentiary record assembled and voted on by the House, which Chairman Nadler has repeatedly claimed constitutes overwhelming evidence for impeachment, how can the Senate be accused of engaging in, what Mr. Nadler described as, “a cover-up,” if the Senate makes its decision based on the exact same evidentiary record the House did? Comment below and let us know what you think.

Trying to lock up Alaskan resource development has consequences that big banks and extreme environmentalists haven’t done the research to understand. As Mayor Harry Brower of Alaska’s North Slope Borough outlines in this op-ed: "Thanks to oil production, our children are no longer forced to live hundreds of miles away from their families simply to attend high school. We are able to eat our native foods, practice our native ceremonies and speak in our native tongues. Many of us now live near a cutting-edge medical clinic.  ...We are able to have all this because we treasure and protect our land and wildlife—the resources that executives and environmental groups in cities thousands of miles away claim to care about."

Congressman Nadler tried to bring his House circus to the floor of the Senate with his insults and accusations of U.S. Senators. Not surprisingly, he failed, and as the Chief Justice admonished - the Senate holds itself to a higher standard. This is the most partisan, rushed and unfair impeachment proceedings in the House that we have seen in modern history. Do you agree? Take our poll: https://bit.ly/2U0oGw3

The Green New Deal would be disastrous for Alaska – immediately banning oil and gas leases on federal lands and the use of hydrocarbons in 10 years. Simply put, it would take Alaska and our economy back in time. As Alaskans, we continue to responsibly push forward on our energy and economic renaissance – creating more opportunity, more energy security and more jobs for Alaskans. This includes responsible energy production on Alaska’s North Slope, but also other sectors of our economy – renewable energy, minerals, timber, fisheries and the value-added industries that go with them.

Today’s Waters of the United States (WOTUS) announcement is a victory for Alaska and the country. By clarifying the misguided and lawless Obama-era rule, we restore power to states, protect land owners, and defend hardworking Alaskans from an insurmountable level of bureaucracy and federal overreach. Without these important changes, bureaucratic red tape would have strangled any new development in our state, making it next to impossible to break ground on even the most basic of infrastructure projects.

The U.S. Senate recently approved Senator Sullivan’s Save Our Seas Act 2.0. That bill takes an aggressive approach to addressing the global plastics crisis -- leveraging new private investments, ensuring our government is prepared to respond to marine debris emergencies, and working to hold foreign nation’s accountable. Donate today to help Dan Sullivan continue the fight in the U.S. Senate to clean up our oceans and address the marine debris and plastics crisis.
Today, we honor Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. – a true American hero whose message of equality and justice reverberate across the world and inspires us every day.

The U.S. Senate just approved USMCA --- the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement --- a monumental agreement for Alaska and the country, and an agreement of many firsts. Not only does it take important steps to rid our oceans of marine debris, this marks the first-time fisheries have been  recognized in a trade agreement as a principal negotiating objective -- bolstering Alaska fisheries and ensuring that fishing remains a cornerstone of our economy. Bottom line, USMCA is going to: ✅ help us clean up our oceans, ✅ bolster our fisheries and coastal communities, ✅ strengthen our economy, ✅ create more jobs, ✅ increase market access, ✅ and level the playing field between Canada, Mexico and the U.S.

“This [impeachment in the Senate] will be in direct contrast to what Adam Schiff and others did when they ran the most partisan, rushed and unfair impeachment proceedings in the House that we have seen in modern history." - Senator Sullivan on Fox New with Dana Perino

Happy Birthday, Alaska! 61 years ago, Alaska was official admitted into the Union as the 49th state.  Our cultures, communities, and our unbreakable spirit are truly the lifeblood of our state. We’ve come a long way, but there’s still more work to be done. I’m excited for the future of Alaska and everything that we can accomplish together.

Happy New Year, Alaska! As I reflect back on the year behind us, I can’t help but be reminded by all the support and encouragement Alaskans have shown me along the way.  2020 will certainly be another year to remember. We are energized and focused on putting up big wins for Alaska and building on the major progress we’ve made in recent years — from rebuilding our military and Coast Guard, opening ANWR, cleaning up our oceans, and making historic investments to public safety in rural Alaska. The stakes are high for both Alaska and the country in 2020. And we need your help. Become a member of Team Dan Sullivan to ensure Alaska’s values and priorities continue moving forward in the years to come. CLICK HERE to join Team Dan Sullivan ⤵️ https://dansullivanforalaska.com/

It’s Christmas, a time of year to reflect on all of the many blessings we enjoy. This is a time of year to celebrate our faith, family, friends, loved ones, and community. This is also a time of year to remember and be grateful for our men and women in the Armed Forces who make sacrifices each and every day, even on Christmas, to keep our country safe. Serving you – my fellow Alaskans – as your U.S. Senator is a true honor and has been one of my life’s biggest blessings. We’ve come a long way, but we still have significant work to do. I am more optimistic than ever for the future of our state and what we can accomplish together.  From my family to yours, Merry Christmas, Happy Hanukkah, and Happy Holidays to all!
